page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: { {Two-thirds of the block is covered by {sea.The land covers parts of the areas {of Crosby and Waterloo on the northern {outskirts of the city of Liverpool.The {area is predominantly flat consisting {of a substantial area of the Mersey {estuary.At low tide a large expanse of {sand is revealed.The area has a mixed {economy:lightindustry,offices,Seaforth { docks and the commercial activity {associated with an area of high {density population e.g.shops.The area {is mainly residential having been {developed in the Victorian/Edwardian {period and the Inter-war years.It is {well served by bus,train and a network {of major roads.In terms of amenities {the area contains:churches,schools,a {park with tennis courts and bowling {greens,ornamental gardens,swimming {baths, a marina and the beach.
